definition: big brother

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
elder brother

sentences.english: That quiet man was an underworld king-pin.
sentences.chinese: 那个安安静静的人是个黑社会老大哥。

sentences.english: He didn't love Julia any more but just loved the Old Brother.
sentences.chinese: 他不再爱乔丽亚了，现在只爱“老大哥”。

sentences.english: Is a Big Brother overprotective meltdown?
In agreeing to take part in Big Brother, the housemates are agreeing to abide by the rules.
sentences.chinese: 同意参加老大哥的房客皆视为同意遵守规则。

definition: old age/very/eldest child in a family/leader of a group/boss/captain of a boat/leader of a criminal gang
mainstay/cornerstone/tower of strength
(argot) gang leader
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
big shot (leading some field or group)/godfather
leader/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
spiritual leader (of a nation or church)/religious leader
fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
although/even though/even if
key figure/the linchpin of sth
old, well-known brand/old style/old school/an old hand/experienced veteran
to hang sb up and beat him
surveyor's pole/post (used for a landmark)/CL:根[gen1]/(fig.) goal/model/benchmark
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
star/big shot/celebrity/leading actor/authority (slang)
person of outstanding talent
